title: What do you want from the claim?
h1: What do you want from your claim
legend: What do you want if your claim is successful? (optional)
detailsSummaryComp: Compensation - what can a tribunal award?

detailsTextComp.p1: If a tribunal decides you've been unfairly dismissed, you'll normally receive compensation which is made up of:
detailsTextComp.li1: a basic award - fixed sum worked out using a standard formula
detailsTextComp.li2: a compensatory award - compensation for the actual money you lost due to your dismissal, or which you expect to lose in future because of your dismissal
detailsTextComp.p2: Compensation can be reduced for various reasons and a tribunal will tell you more about this if it applies in your specific circumstances.
detailsTextComp.p3: In disciplinary or grievance cases, you may be entitled to an increased award if an employer fails to follow the guidance set out in the Acas Code of Practice on disciplinary and grievance procedures.
detailsTextComp.p4: Similarly, awards can be reduced if a tribunal decides you've failed to follow the guidance set out in the Acas Code of Practice on disciplinary and grievance procedures.
detailsTextComp.p5: In certain claims, such as those involving discrimination, a tribunal may compensate you for 'injury to feelings' (individual hurt and distress you may have suffered) in addition to compensation for financial loss.

detailsTextRecom: If your employer is found to have discriminated against you, a tribunal can make a recommendation that the respondent take specific steps to reduce the effect of the discrimination on you
compensationOnlyHint: You’ll be asked to provide an estimate of total compensation
